Formaldehyde releasers.description: Preservatives that may release formaldehyde, a known carcinogen and strong allergen

Parabens.description: Preservatives suspected of disrupting hormones and linked to breast cancer in studies

Phthalates.description: Used in fragrances; linked to reproductive toxicity and hormone disruption

Chemical UV filters.description: Sunscreen agents that may disrupt hormones or irritate skin

BHA/BHT.description: Synthetic antioxidants flagged for potential cancer and endocrine disruption

Coal tar dyes.description: Colorants potentially contaminated with heavy metals or carcinogens

PEGs.description: Emulsifiers that may contain impurities like 1,4-dioxane (a possible carcinogen)

Ethanolamines.description: May form nitrosamines, linked to cancer risk

Fragrance.description: Catch-all term that may hide allergens and hormone-disrupting chemicals

Phenoxyethanol.description: Common preservative that may irritate eyes and skin at high concentrations

Silicones.description: Can clog pores and cause buildup on sensitive skin

Sulfates.description: Cleansers that can dry or irritate the skin

Talc.description: May be contaminated with asbestos unless purified

Preservatives (low risk).description: Generally safe preservatives but may irritate sensitive skin
